greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Shifts left under GCD-convolution with itself.
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210; arXiv:math/0205301 [math.CO], 2002.

M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to Lin. Alg. Applic. version together with omitted figures]
mathematica: a[0]=1; a[1]=1; a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[GCD[a[k], a[n-k-1]], {k, 0, n-1}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 60}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 07 2012, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) N=66; v=vector(N);  v[1]=1; for(n=2,N, v[n]=sum(k=1,n-1, gcd(v[k],v[n-k])) ); v  \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Jun 30 2013
f xs = y : f (y:xs) where y = sum $ zipWith gcd xs $ reverse xs
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
